reviewText: Holy crap, you ready for this?  A new horror game...made on the Unity engine...which is not only really good, but really, really SCARY!  I, for one, am gobsmacked.  Great graphics, INCREDIBLE sound...though I'm not 100% sold on the rogue-like or permadeath elements, especially with a 50/50 chance of returning to THE START OF THE GAME if you just happen to choose the wrong door" in Limbo-land after you "die"; and the fact that you'll sometimes spawn right near the power switch to the Exit elevator
date: and other times several MILES away...sigh.  But it still works...mostly...\n\nSo okay
recommended: there's isn't that much "story" per se - though the "recurring nightmares" premise is always a nice one - but it's pretty clear on the whole that this game is pig-headedly dedicated to the cause of SPOOKING THE LIVING ♥♥♥♥ out of you
hoursPlayed: and that surely can't be a bad thing for the "horror" genre.  An almost relentlessly oppressive atmosphere
voteText: genuinely effective jump-scares
votesTotal: certainly has all of those.  It also has quite a bit of repetition...especially if you keep dying (and somehow living
votesFunny: in spite of the aforementioned door thing)
commentsCount: and have to keep redoing levels over and over again (procedural generation be damned
column16: it's still much of a muchness to me).  But even if you don't have the patience to ever "beat" the game

reviewText:
This is the scariest game I have ever played.I've played Silent Hill, Fatal Frame, Resident Evil, Amnesia, and several other horror games. I am a Horror game junkie, and this game blew me away with it's scares. It provides a perfect blend of subtle terror, atmosphere, clever jumpscares and lurking scares, and brilliant sound design and visual design. This is some P.T.-level horror.

However, the gameplay is not perfect. I feel the game suffers from being a little too dark with not enough candles. You can strike a quick light to see your way (which can also provide some great hallucination scares) or simply use your map. It just gets difficult when trying to spot a chest, newspaper, or power switch,

The omly true frustrating moments in the gameplay are the time-restricted floors (10 minutes is very unforgiving and relies heavily on luck) as well as the permadeath mechanic. I managed to somehow, some way, cheat death 7 times before succumbing to Permadeath, but it is a very terrible feeling to reach so far into the game, which is decently long at around 7 hours on average, only to lose everything and start over at the beginning based on essentially a coin-flip 50/50 chance of continuing or game over.

The good news is, there are no cheap deaths except during the final two dungeons. I found myself killed twice by something that I didn't even see without warning, but it may have been my own fault because up until that point, no death was cheap or instant.

Minor personal gripes from me are towards the Hotel area itself. There was one moment that absolutely terrified me regarding the lights. However, this didn't last and would have made for some absolutely fantastic horror in the otherwise 'safe' environment. More of that would have been great, but sadly there wasn't much after that other than a few sounds here or there.

Overall, as a horror game, this is one of the scariest ones out there and for me to fully fear going anywhere or doing anything in this game because I'm afraid of what's hiding in the darkness is truly an amazing feat to do. I'd say just rebalance and clean up the actual gameplay a little bit and you've got a real winner. I hope to see a Dungeon Nightmares 3. I will most certainly LP that one too!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vxVXR3n1woE
voteText: 17 of 21 people (81%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
If you're having problems playing the game, I might have a solution! When launching the game from steam, the game always crashes. What I did to fix this, is find the game in the folder and run as admin. So, go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Dungeon Nightmares II - The Memory. Right click, run as admin, and now you can play the game!! However, playing this way doesn't log hours in steam!!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCY_e8K6GJA&list=PLKMxTuqznyPMEEl1TkR0hTuGwklyApuvO&index=1

Now to the actually game. I've put in more than .2 hours, but as I said, steam doesn't log the hours currently. But the game is great so far. The atmosphere is tense, and the jump scares are plenty. If you enjoyed the game vanish, you'll definitely enjoy this! Many horror games struggle with jump scares, sometimes they're poorly executed, or there's just too many of them. But this game does a perfect job of balancing them, and building an environment that's terrifying even without the jump scares. The permadeath is horrible though, it doesn't add to the scare factor as much as it adds to pure annoyance. Having some sort of checkpoint system would be nice. If you want to check out the game before buying, check out my video as well!

reviewText:
(eng) / (rus)
Another Unity engine first-person horror. Sounds scary enough? Yep, I also shake everytime I see the logo at the start. Apart from that it's a decent randomized story about a woman who suddenly got lost in a nightmarish maze of copy-paste elements and merciless triggers under her hotel. She probably woke up from a bad dream in her room and decided to go check in the basement for the continuation.. or vice versa. Anyway, she's trapped in that empty old building with rusty elevators, clanging chains and pixellated cobwebs. There we also 100% encounter missing girl's portraits, used torture instruments, sceleton parts, mouldy books etc. She can't run or duck, but she can light the unnecessary candles if you find some and interact with objects. The game's not bad, the random architecture, strange letters and realistic sound effects keep the intrigue alive. Remember, you totally don't have to feel scared until the trigger works, but certainly no one shall stop you if you want to! Also, to shut a screamer up I just shout some obscene words at the monitor twice as loud, this helps a lot! Have fun!

Еще один ужас от первого лица на двигле Единство. Звучит достаточно страшно? Я тоже трясусь каждый раз, как вижу этот логотип при запуске. В остальном это неплохая случайно генерируемая история про женщину, которая внезапно потерялась в жутком лабиринте размноженных под копирку элементов и беспощадных спусковых крючков под ее гостиницей. Она, видимо, проснулась от дурного сна в своей комнате и решила сходить проверить в подвале насчет продолжения... или наоборот. В любом случае, она поймана в этом пустом старом здании с ржавыми лифтами, звенящими цепями и пикселизованными паутинами. Также мы стопудово встретим портреты пропавшей девочки, б/у пыточный инструментарий, части скелетов, плесневелые книжки и пр. Она не может бегать и приседать, но умеет зажигать бесполезные свечи, если удастся их найти, и взаимодействовать с объектами. Игра не плоха, случайная архитектура, странные письма и реалистичные звуки поддерживают интригу. Только помните, что совсем не обязательно бояться, пока не сработает спусковой механизм, но если хотите, то никто не собирается мешать! Также, чтобы заткнуть крикуна, я просто матерюсь в экран вдвое громче него, это здорово помогает! Наслаждайтесь!

reviewText: I have to say that this is the only horror game that genuinely scares and makes me feel uneasy.  It is due to the fact that this game is not script heavy making every moment a constant suspension. Also, the graphic and atmosphere are perfect. I only played the demo version and a little bit of the full game so far and i am genuinely scared and need to gather more courage to continue unlike many other horror games which i can breeze through. This game also has endless playability. 5 stars to Kmonkie!

reviewText:
Ok, I changed my review a bit since I played it more. I still recommend this game since it's a good horror game if you enjoy jump scares, which some will bash out of the wall and kill you.

Pros:
*Creepy atmosphere - voices whispering, odd sounds, and the shaking of the screen kept me on my seat.
*Actual enemies - There are actual enemies that WILL bash through a wall to chase you down. Run!
*The randomization of the dungeon - helps when you get stuck and keeps things interesting to explore a new maze.

Cons:
*Repetitive - explore new maze to find a new key to a new hotel room. It gets old after a while to the edge of boring.
*glitches - I found one glitch where if I alt-tab out it will exit my game where I will have to reboot it up again.
*No pause? - not sure if this is a glitch or just me, but when I tried pressing start the background jumpscares continued.

That's my opinion so far of this game, and I'll probably add more when I do more playing. It's a decent game, not the best out there, but decent nonetheless.

reviewText: I bought this game after watching someone eles play it on youtube ( matt & pats ♥♥♥♥♥torm). all i have to say is that for people who get easily scared will probably have a heart attack playing this game, but if ur like me and you have seen a lot of horror movies and games, this wont startle you unti you very deep in the game (for me it started getting weird on dungeon 3). i love that this game straight up challenges me to keep going not knowing what may be waiting in the dark emptyness of each dungeon. there are however 2 gripes i have, one is the candles. the candles arent very useful, their light isnt very bright making them rather worthless. the secound thing that im not happy with is that the story items you collect in a dungeon cannot be viewed when your outside of the dungeon and back in your room.

reviewText: This is very spooky. I can tell a lot of love went into the development as it is quite complete for a one (wo)man dev. reviewText:
The game is a truly terrifying experience, but unfortunately the Roguelike elements of the game hurt the horror and ultimately hold it back. There are a few cheap deaths that are not really foreseeable, yet you may find your way through most of the game only to die to something you couldn't see coming in the final night. Then you have to pass a coin flip to have your progress save, so you don't have to redo all the prior nights. Needless to say, repeating segments you have already done, encountering the same scares and sounds multiple times due to a cheap death, glitched of gimmicky, causes all the horror to go right out the window.

On the topic of glitching, the game is rather buggy. Half a dozen+ times I had to repeat the floor I was on because I fell through the ground. This wouldn't be a huge problem if it wasn't for the fact that later nights become windy labyrinths with extreme amounts of backtracking involved.

If you want a terrifying experience, well, none will be more terrifying the first time you go through it than Dungeon Nightmares II. However, should you find yourself towards the end of the game, only to die to some cheap gotchya" kill that you can't really foresee
date: you may be understandably annoyed as I was. And then on replaying the game
recommended: may find it to be less enticing or interesting
hoursPlayed: and more just an exercise in futility. If you're ok with that
voteText: then this is your game. But if you are not interested in a horror experience that will go from terrifying to grueling as the time goes on
helpfulPercent: than you may want to take your money elsewhere."

reviewText:
Being a huge lover of the Horror genre, whether it be Movies or Games, I am very critical when it comes to reviewing and rating..
I try to be reasonably fair when pointing out pros and cons.. I also try to see the product for what it is rather than what would make the game better (the - what-ifs") as those comments should be left in the feedback section of any forum.

Simply put - I Won't take 1 point off my review on a product just because it is missing; say for example graphics bug
date:
or in this game for instance you only get very few candles that don't last too long).. These things don't affect my review on games because the game developers can fix these things when customers give feedback and suggestions..

So I will be doing my review based on 1 simple criteria. Rating the game for "What it is" rather than "what it could or should be".

On to the review-rating....

I first played this game on Android "Dungeon Nightmares" and i was blown away by the pretty much everything.

The detail
hoursPlayed: sound effects etc..\n\nThen i came across Dungeon Nightmare II : The Memory on PC -Steam- and thought to myself
voteText: "I MUST HAVE THIS GAME
helpfulPercent: IT HAS TO BE GOOD".\n\nSo without any hesitation at all I purchased this game on steam and Immediately started to play it briefly. Mainly just to test out the gameplay
votesTotal: and the whole Suspense and build-up for random screen flashes and things running toward you and disappearing..\n\nI'll tell you one thing for certain
votesFunny: I was not disappointed and I was glad i made the choice to purchase this game..\n\nI like the fact you can find hidden walls and break them down
commentsCount: I love the extreme amount of detail that has gone in to making everything look realistic. The more realistic it looks
column16: the more intense everything feels. ( I love to play these games in the dark
column17:
with the sound up) ***BIG GRIN**.

This game gave me constant goosebumps which is another sign of the awesome intense feel of the game.

I don't like to spoil the game for other people so i leave my reviews of games to a minimum amount of spoilers (if any) but try to be informative and detailed about the game's quality as it is..

And if you're crazy about the Horror genre like i am and love those intense and immersive games that can potentionally make you jump out of your seat
column18:
then i HIGHLY recommend this game to you.

Rating 9.0/10

A brilliant & uniquely immersive and intense game.."

reviewText:
I want to like this game, but I can't. The game has a great athmosphere and has one of the best jumpscares ever. It could even be one of the best horror games ever.
But there are some features or bugs in this game that just kill it and take away the scare factor.


one annoying thing is when I look at the map, the area around me is inviseble. I tried the game on a other pc and it didnt hapen there. So it is fair to say that the problem is my computer.

The second reason is the breathing from the protagonist. It is really annoying and just takes away the scares or even the panicing moments. I dont have the feeling that I'm actualy there.

The tirth reason , and this is the one that made me quit. I died on the 7th level beacaus of a fire trap. then the game
decided to give me a choice. I had 2 doors in front of me and i had to pick one of them. If I made the correct choise then I could continue exploring the dungeon. but I made the wrong choice. I thougth you just had to do the level again from the start. But, the result was even worse. It put me back on the main menu and my save file was deleted and there was no way to use the continue option. I had to start back from the first level.
I dont want to play back from the beginning. there is just no point. I know the scares on the previous levels. it takes everything away from being scared.


This could be a great game, but making me lose my progress becaus of a chance game. Just ruind everything

reviewText:
Greetings fellow gamers! This is Gamer Guy (In a Suit) from the Echo Army YouTube channel! Today I am bringing you a review of the Indie Horror game Dungeon Nightmares II: The Memory. Dungeon Nightmares II: The Memory was released on Steam on September 14, 2015 by Developer/Publisher K Monkey.

(NOTE: This game was NOT reviewed using a key provided by the Developer and/or Publisher, it was a game I purchased for my own account)

Video Review:

https://youtu.be/cOYKzdujxD8

The Too Long
date:
Didn't Watch" Review:

Nice atmospheric horror game. Hidden gem on Steam. 4/5 worth $10 (goes for $9)

The "Meat & Potatoes" Review:

Dungeon Nightmares II: The Memory is another First-Person Indie Horror game available on Steam
recommended: of which there are TONS these days. However
hoursPlayed: I try to find the ones that stand out and are worth a gamers time. This is one. This little gem is tucked away
voteText: hidden deep within Steam. It has less than 50 reviews at this time
helpfulPercent: which for Steam is pretty low for a game that has been out for several months. This game deserves your attention. It has 100% procedurally-generated maps
votesHelpful: an AI that appears to be really good and learns from your behaviors and evolves
votesFunny: a fantastically creepy atmosphere and of course
commentsCount: that combat-free gameplay that leaves you feeling SO helpless against your struggles! This game even has some controller support. I really liked the atmosphere of this one a lot. It was easy to get lost once you turned the lights off and threw the headphones on. It relies much more on the atmosphere then it does actual "jump scares' and the tediousness of the randomized dungeons add to your despair. Do not miss this hidden gem on Steam. You can grab it for $9 ($4.50 during the Sale!!!) and it is totally worth it. 4/5 and glad I found this one.\n\nHappy Gaming!"

reviewText:

reviewText:
It's a good game. Great game. I love it! That said...

I think I need help from the CReator or the Community here whom have beaten the game. I have been trying the final stage; the part wehere you have to escape through Hell. For the past two weeks now. 4 games a day. And I keep dying.

One: How do you know if the ground will spout fire or not? Is there any indication from below you as you are walking? Or is it that you just have to run and hope for the best that it dosen't rise from below?

Secondly: I like to call him the 'Grim Reaper'. Or 'Death'. There is this monster that Auto-Kills you in the game. He starts with a 'Impending Doom' music; then foot steps then no matter where you are; he just Auto-Kills you. Now is this a Timed mechanic?

Like you only have a certain amount of time to escape Hell or Death Auto-Kills you? I mean- this is a totally unfair game mechanic. It takes ages for you to find the Skull, Switch and Elevator. Dodgeing Flameing Babies; and that Screetching Woman and that damn RED SKULL!

So is there a way... to avoid Death from Auto-Killing you? Or is it just a Timed in-game mechanic? Please help!

reviewText: This game is the scariest game I've played so far. I'm a youtuber that plays mostly horror (or at keast I try and stick with mostly that genre) and I don't regret buying this game one bit. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes jumpscares, the thrill of feeling watched and being chased defencless, and also a puzzle/maze game. I'd say don't play in the dark but thats the best time to play it. If its light out, you can barely see anything.

reviewText:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Horror game.


Interface/Menu/Settings
Journal thing. It's just your statistic.
There is a mouse senstivity.

About the game.
You are lurking around the dungeon to find some clues and collect them before you are able to leave a dungeon.
Then you are waking up at the hotel and from there you basically start the new dungeon again. The game is randomized with perma-deaths. Game is extremely dark and it's very difficult to see. However you have a map so you will not get lost and you know which locations are still unrevealed. The only thing what i didnt like about the game is the ammount of jumpscares. Which are random even too. The game has traps, lores and alot of loud sound. Which you can only turn lower at your speaker volume. The only thing what you have is a spark of light and sometimes candles.

Has lame Jumpscares.
Atmosphere is okay.
Too dark.
Randomized.
Has some kind of a story.

Other things.
I don't really like jumpscares.. Using jumpscares into a game is the cheapest thing to call it a horror" genre.

Developer has thumps this review down which is decreasing the score points to 3.

-------------------

I Give this game a 3/10"

reviewText: Don't let my low play time fool you - it's only because this game is terrifying and I'm a coward.  I'll try to play some more.  How do I recommend a game that is just too scary for me to play?  Well, if that's your thing - if you like scary - this is your game.  Holy crap it's scary.  I used to think Slender was scary - but this takes the cake.

reviewText:
First of all i would just like to say that this game is amazing, i mean, im a hardcore horror fan myself and even THIS left me shaking in my seat.  Whoever made this game is literally a genius because not only does this game have an amazing concept, but also smooth gameplay and true horror.

I would say that this game is highly recommended whether you are new to horror OR a hardcore fan like me, this game is great for all types as no two plays are the same.

First play
go down elevator to dungeon
find a skeleton
spark my lighter to get a look around
skeleton murders me  (dead)

Second play
elevator stops as i plummet to the basement (half dead)
find a door, gets impaled (more dead)
walk through a hall, guilotine (almost dead)
finally find what i needed, monster pops up, im cornered (dead)

i give this game a 9/10    and to the creators, keep up the great work!

reviewText:
Dungeon Nightmares 2 is an incredibly tense and atmospheric horror game that is sure to give even the hardiest gamer a fright or two along the path. The game has been improved upon exponentially since the initial demo and even that was a pretty scary game!! My old pal Charlie the Skeleton is up to his old tricks too, chasing us when we don't pay him enough attention.

Anyways I highly recommend this game to any horror fan out there......what are you waiting for? go get it :)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=frM0CoQ-f_Q

reviewText:
Like a bad budget title from the 90's repackaged as a new game. Virtually unplayable.

To simplify why you shouldn't play this game:

1. The game is very laggy at the fastest" setting with no way to improve responsiveness that you can feel in the game.
2. The graphics quality from the highest setting to the lowest is virtually the same
date: and at best the game looks like a mid-tier title from 15 to 20 years ago. That's not an exaggeration
recommended: nor is there anything retro about the design. The graphics are just horrible.\n3. Bad graphics and slow responsiveness are combined with picking up small items that require you to stand at the exact place and click the exact pixel unlike interacting with other items.\n4. The level design is awful and very cramped. Desks and bookshelves are so proportionally huge that they almost block every hallway. I understand strange things can happen in survival horror games
hoursPlayed: but out of proportion items that prohibit a player from walking to point A to point B are a hallmark of bad level design.\n5. The audio is absolutely awful. The soundtrack is the cliched heartbeat
voteText: and the sound of your footsteps is quickly annoying. The sound of your feet will awkwardly cut in with that low-quality-at-a-higher-volume static
helpfulPercent: and it's just a 3 second loop. You don't hear your footsteps; you hear an old sound file from the 90's of footsteps.\n\nThis really feels like a poorly designed game from the late 90's. The level design is horrible
votesFunny: and the controls are horrible. This is the first time on Steam where I have felt scammed buying a game. It feels like someone took a budget title they found at the dollar store back  in the 90's and repackaged it with the help of the Unity game design suite. You wouldn't play this game for free
commentsCount: let alone pay for it. I really feel ripped off.\n\nIf you want to struggle trying to walk down hallways because the furniture is too big just to struggle picking up a candle while muting the low quality sound loops of heartbeats and footsteps
column16: this is the game for you. Otherwise
column17: don't make the mistake I made and get scammed looking for something new in the survival horror genre."
